page.title: 05TALKING ABOUT HALL FARM
page.content: We went to see Mr Robert Claydon the farmer at Hall Farm, which is near the Silverley church remains. He showed us around his arable farm. They have 1000 acres which are used for barley, sugar beet, and wheat. They send some of their food to the people in Ethiopia who are starving. Most of the corn is stored in a big barn, and goes off to a corn merchant. There are some meadows for grazing. They use to have working horses and pigs but they now only have horses which don't work.There are six and a half helpers: six work full time and one works part time.There are ten machines altogether: six tractors, one digger, one drill, one combine harvester and one machine for heavy lifting. There is a pond nearby to drain water from the fields, with a ditch leading to a local river.
